column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=( ( WSS ) )
#Text=How do you feel about the support you received from the conservative publication , The Weekly Standard ?
#Text=Wolfe : Well , Mr. Kristol can publish whatever he wants to .
#Text=It sure surprised me .
#Text=But Mr. Kristol is a very keen observer .
#Text=I do n't always agree with him on what he writes , but he is one of the most articulate spokesmen in American politics .

#Text=( ( WSS ) ) In the interview you had with The Weekly Standard , you said that you are the only Democratic challenger to Obama that is actively campaigning . What kind of activities do you take part in for the campaign ?
#Text=Wolfe : Well , what we do is we call people .
#Text=We make sure we get our message out .

#Text=We 're on the radio every now and then and we have n't bought any TV or radio ads yet ; they 're a little bit too expensive , but we 're going to try to , here toward the end , to get on the radio to get our message out in a more conventional way .
#Text=And we have recently bought some inserts , things like that , for the newspaper .
#Text=And gotten our message out to some of the people in Arkansas .
#Text=It 's a very expensive thing .
#Text=This campaign has been something I 've wanted to do , but I 've had to make a lot of personal sacrifices to do it .
#Text=Challenging the incumbent

#Text=( ( WSS ) ) I mentioned that interview you had with The Weekly Standard . During that interview , you said that you opposed same-sex marriage even though you backed the repeal of " Do n't ask , do n't tell " . Might this hurt you with Democrats looking for a progressive alternative to Barack Obama ?
#Text=Wolfe : Yeah my record on so much of the issue , on gay rights , I mean I have a good record on it .

#Text=In 1979 in Memphis when I was part of the student government , I was the adviser and also the so-called attorney general , I mean , there were issues that came up on the campus where they wanted to ban gay meetings .
#Text=This was back in ' 79 .
#Text=I stood up there in 1979 and told the people they were wrong for doing it .
#Text=In 2010 , before the most conservative audience ever in Cleveland , Tennessee , this is on video tape , I said , no , let 's get rid of do n't ask , do n't tell , it 's not right .
#Text=If someone wants to serve their country , they should .
#Text=You only want heterosexuals to spill blood for the country ?
#Text=Do n't you think the sacrifice ought to be equally borne ?
#Text=I came out against do n't ask , do n't tell before anybody else around this section of the country .
#Text=I do n't think it was right then , and I do n't think it 's right now .
#Text=Wolfe speaks at a Congressional candidates forum in 2010 .
#Text=Image : millermz .
#Text=I am for equality .
#Text=I just have a little bit of a hard time with accepting gay marriage .
#Text=I got to look into it a little bit more and see what the ramifications of it are .
#Text=But I think that the idea of hate crimes and longer sentences for hate crimes is a good idea because people do commit those .
#Text=They do n't just commit it against the individual .
#Text=They will tend to be recidivist because they do n't just hate an individual , they hate the whole group .

#Text=And when they do that , of course you have longer sentences because that means their rate of doing it again is going to be higher than somebody that just commits an individual crime against an individual .
#Text=They 're going against the whole race .
#Text=The same thing would be true for somebody that wanted to beat up Jewish people , or they wanted to assault Catholics , or whoever .
#Text=Sure there should be more time .
#Text=There should be a special classification for hate crimes .
#Text=I think the idea of no discrimination by the federal government in hiring based on sexual orientation is the right kind of law to make .
#Text=I think there should be equality .
